step1.sentence: She decided to delegate more tasks to her team in order to make room for growth within the organization.

step2.story: After years of doing everything herself, Maya realized her micromanaging was holding the team back. She began to step aside on smaller decisions to make room for growth in her colleagues. Within months, the team was thriving with new ideas she never would have thought of alone.

step3.story: Daniel had built his small bakery from nothing, and for a long time he kept every recipe locked in his head, afraid to share his secrets. But as orders piled up and burnout crept in, he knew something had to change. A mentor told him he needed to make room for growth — to trust others, to let go, and to think bigger than what one pair of hands could create. Reluctantly, he started training apprentices and writing down his methods. The bakery expanded, and Daniel found himself spending less time in the kitchen and more time dreaming up new flavors. What he once feared losing, he had actually multiplied.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 공간을 만들다, 즉 물리적 또는 비유적으로 무언가가 들어올 자리를 마련하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 주로 비유적으로 사용되며, 개인·조직·관계에서 발전이나 변화가 일어날 수 있도록 여유와 기회를 의도적으로 확보하는 것을 뜻한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'make room'은 중세 영어부터 '자리를 내주다'는 뜻으로 쓰였으며, 'for growth(성장을 위해)'와 결합해 현대 영어에서 성장·발전의 여지를 마련한다는 의미로 굳어졌다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 공간을 비우는 것이 아니라, 미래를 위해 현재의 편안함이나 통제권을 내려놓는 능동적이고 긍정적인 행위를 강조하는 표현이다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We restructured the team to make room for growth in the new product division.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 우리는 새 제품 부서에서 성장의 여지를 만들기 위해 팀을 재편성했다.
